alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Dale, southern Henry and north central Houston Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kinsey, or near Headland, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Headland, Dothan, Kinsey, Cowarts, Webb, Grimes, Newville, Napier Field, Haleburg, Barnes, Tumbleton, Kirkland Crossroads, Hardwickburg, Blackwood, Capps, Grandberry Crossroads, Kelly Springs, Murphy Station and Headland Municipal A/P. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
